result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *AMENDMENT 03/27/2017 - Amended to reflect sentence credit in the amount of 160 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-------------------------------------

Not to have contact with any known drug dealers or users. No contact with anyone identified on Exhibit #3. Not to possess or use any alcohol or controlled substance. Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
-------------------------------------

Must undergo any and all treatment assessment and participate in any and all treatment that the DOC deems necessary.
-------------------------------------
Reimburse Walworth County Drug Unit in the amount of $120.00 for buy money.
-----------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------------

Application for Jail Time Credit form
Temporary Commitment form filed
BOND QUASHED

1:33 pm  Defendant Matthew  Brown in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.   Zeke S. Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Procedurally, Court notes that it was brought to its attention that PSI was written based on plea to Ct 1 which was actually dismissed and read-in.  Defendant pled to Ct 2.
Attorney Cafferty notes there is also error in PSI indicating defendant was found guilty at trial and defendant entered a plea and was not found guilty at trial.
Attorney Cafferty confers with defendant and advises Court that they are ready proceed and are not asking PSI be remanded back for corrections.
State has reviewed letter submitted by defense.
1:39 pm  Deputy Cory Newmann, WCSD, duly sworn and testifies on exam of DA Wiedenfeld.
2 pm  Exh 1 marked for identification by witness.
2:01 pm  Exh 2 marked for identification by witness.
2:01 pm  Exhs 1 and 2 offered into evidence by DA Wiedenfeld.  Attorney Cafferty has no objection.  Court receives.
2:06 pm  Exh 3 marked and identified as copy of large posterboard.
2:13 pm  Exh 3 offered into evidence by DA Wiedenfeld and received with no objection by Attorney Cafferty.
2:15 pm  Cross by Attorney Cafferty.
2:24 pm  Redirect by DA Wiedenfeld.
2:29 pm  Followup by Attorney Cafferty.
2:29 pm  Court questions witness.
2:30 pm  Argument by DA Wiedenfeld.
2:37 pm  Attorney Cafferty requests Court adopt recommendation of PSI writer.
2:45 pm  Defendant addresses Court.
2:47 pm  Court takes brief recess and will resume at 2:55 pm.

2:57 pm  Back on the record.  Court is ready to pronounce sentence having heard testimony and considering SM 34 factors.
Court imposes the following sentence:
Twelve (12) years in prison divided as follows:  seven (7) years initial confinement followed by five (5) years extended supervision.
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Pay court costs including all supervision fees and buy money in the amount of $120.
Defendant is not to have any contact with any known drug dealers or users.  No contact with anyone identified on Exhibit 3.
Defendant must undergo any and all treatment assessment and participate in any and all treatment that the DOC deems necessary.
Not to possess or use any alcohol or controlled substances.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Not to posses any firearms.
Court will find defendant eligible for both CIP and SAP.
3:20 pm  Court in recess.
Defendant Matthew  Brown in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI ordered. Minutes filed.

1:53 pm  Defendant Matthew  Brown in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Cafferty apologizes for being late due to road conditions.
After reviewing video Attorney Cafferty believes defendant was properly mirandized and withdraws his motion.
Future dates remain.
Minutes filed.

Request for Miranda/Goodchild Hearing

Scheduling Order
Copies provided to Counsel in Court on this date

Defendant Matthew  Brown in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew  Brown in court with attorney Patrick Cafferty.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to withdraw as counsel of record by attorney Sanders granted. Motion deadline 06-23-16.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

3:09 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Matthew  Brown in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  
Matter is before the Court to determine if Defendant has retained a new Attorney.  
Atty Brown indicates he is not able to retain Attorney Cafferty.  
Attorney Sanders has provided Mr. Brown with the names of Attorneys but none of those Attorneys were able to represent him because they represented co-actors in this matter or had some other conflict in representing Mr. Brown.  Mr. Brown has 2 additional attorneys that he will be meeting with, and he is requesting an addtional week or two to meet with these Attorneys.  Mr. Brown works full time for a construction company based out of Skokie.  Defendant lives with his mother who is present in Court today.  Attorney Sanders confirms that he has provided Mr. Brown with the names of several attorneys.  Court expresses its concerns that this is happening for the purpose of delay and notes it has been set for trial 4 times.   Court explains circumstances which could result in forfeiture of the defendant's right to counsel in this matter.  Attorney Necci has nothing further to offer but notes that the State is prepared to try this case at any time.  Attorney Sanders believes Mr. Brown deserves the opportunity to retain an attorney.  Court will set another court date in two weeks.  Court expects Mr. Brown to appear at that time with a new Attorney and if not, he should be prepared to explain why he does not have an attorney.  
3:20 pm  Court in recess.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

3:16 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Defendant Matthew  Brown in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sanders files a Motion to Withdraw as Counsel.  Mr. Brown is requesting Atty Sanders withdraw.  The defendant has either retained or is in the process of retaining private counsel.  Court makes record with regard to the withdrawal of defendant's previous counsel.  Court notes there is nothing to show that Mr. Cafferty has been retained nor is he in Court here today.  Court notes this case was filed two years ago.  Court is not granting the request for Atty Sanders to withdraw.  Mr. Brown indicated he has plans to meet with Mr. Cafferty after Court.  Atty Sanders requests a brief recess so that he and Mr. Brown can confer.  3:19 pm  Court in recess.  

3:38 pm  Court in session.  Case has been recalled.  Same appearances.  During the break the Court did some research on this circumstance and reviewed some case law.  Court wishes to make a further record with regard to whether or not to allow Attorney Sanders to withdraw.  Atty Sanders indicates he is not prepared to go to trial.  He and Mr. Brown have had difficulty communicating.  Court asks what length of preparation Atty Sanders has put in on this case since November.  Response by Atty Sanders to Court's questions.  Court notes Atty Sanders has trial experience.  Atty Sanders indicates he and Mr. Brown do not communicate well.  Court notes that the Deft's prior counsel made a similar record as to attempts to communicate and meet with Mr. Brown.  Court's concern is that this is a pattern of behavior by Mr. Brown.  Continued discussion between Court and Atty Sanders.  Atty Sanders indicates this is not a delaying tactics on his end.  It's his understanding that Mr. Brown's family have been saving money to retain an attorney.  Atty Sanders does not believe it is a situation that can be reconciled.  Response by DA Necci that they are ready to go to trial on Monday but also doesn't believe it is any fault of Atty Sanders.  Court finds that Mr. Brown is at fault for the break down in the Atty-Client relationship.  Court will allow Mr. Brown to speak but cautions him that anything he says will be made a part of the record.  3:55 pm  Statement by Mr. Brown.  Continued discussion between Court and Mr. Brown.  Atty Sanders makes further record as to his attempts to meet with Mr. Brown to review discovery.  3:59 pm  Atty Necci makes a record with regard to the video that is being referred to. Court still believes the defendant is at fault for the break down in the relationship.  Continued discussion concerning the video that Atty Sanders was not able to review.  Court is taking the Motion to Withdraw under advisement.  Court will take the jury trial off Monday.  Atty Sanders is not allowed to withdraw until the Defendant has retained Atty Cafferty.  Mr. Brown says he will be meeting with Atty Cafferty some time this week.  Court is canceling the JT and will set this matter on the Court's calendar for a status conference.  STATUS CONFERENCE SCHEDULED FOR APRIL 26, 2016 AT 3:00 PM
4:08 pm  Court in recess.

Defendant Matthew  Brown in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew  Brown in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 12-17-15. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Atty Jason Sanders
Order to Withdraw as Defendant's Attorney

Defendant Matthew  Brown in court with attorney Stephen Richard Kramer.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before the Court for a Final Pre-trial.  This case is scheduled for a Jury Trial on Monday and Tuesday of next week.  Attorney Kramer has filed a Motion to Withdraw as Defendant's Attorney.  Attorney Kramer makes a record as to his reasons for filing this Motion. Response by Mr. Brown.  The Court will allow Attorney Kramer to withdraw.  Court advises Mr. Brown that the Public Defender's office will appoint new counsel.  Court cancels Jury Trial and sets this matter for a status conference.  Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
